snippet: The Pentagon will reimburse Pakistan $688 million for stationing troops along the Afghan border, an effort to normalize support for the Pakistani military.
abstract: Pentagon has quietly notified Congress that it will reimburse Pakistan nearly $700 million for cost of stationing 140,000 troops on border with Afghanistan, effort to normalize support for Pakistani military after nearly two years of crises and mutual retaliation.

byline.original: By ERIC SCHMITT and DAVID E. SANGER
byline.contributor: Declan Walsh contributed reporting from Islamabad, Pakistan.

lead_paragraph: The Pentagon will reimburse Pakistan $688 million for stationing troops along the Afghan border, an effort to normalize support for the Pakistani military.

headline.main: In Sign of Normalization, Pentagon to Reimburse Pakistan $688 Million
headline.print_headline: In Sign of Normalization, Pentagon To Reimburse Pakistan $688 Million

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
keywords.name: subject
